definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: They successfully organized many activities in their community.
sentences.chinese: 他們把社區活動搞得風風火火，有聲有色。

sentences.english: But I didn't have anything to do with turning him into a whiz kid.
sentences.chinese: 但是我沒有讓他變成一個風風火火的孩子。

sentences.english: She is always in a great hurry and for that reason mother says she is not like a girl.
sentences.chinese: 她做事總是風風火火的，媽媽說她不像個女孩。

definition: lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
lit. to pour cold water on/fig. to dampen one's enthusiasm
pass like thunder and move like the wind (idiom); swift and decisive reaction
Trouble issues from the mouth (idiom). A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
